questions.text: What is one trait that marks Mowgli as a Westerner?
questions.correct: He is able to buy bottles of vodka
options: He reacts to the cold weather
His skin is a different color
questions.explanation:
He is able to buy bottles of vodka.

	Mowgli has traveled the world searching for Bigby, who disappeared just after Snow and their seven children went to live on the Farm. It's hard to track a man who doesn't want to be found, and Mowgli's alcohol-buying ability does him no good in "Fables" #48, which went on sale in 2006.

Mister Sunflower.

	"Mister Sunflower says Daddy eats people!" one of the cubs tells their mother, Snow White. "Mister Sunflower has anger issues." she cooly responds in "Fables" #48, which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: Mowgli finally gets clues to Bigby's whereabouts from wolves.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In issues #48 and #49, Mowlgi runs with the wolves once again to learn the whereabouts of Bigby, who can transform into a wolf at will. Mowgli sometimes has to resort to violence to get what he wants, but get it he does. Mowgli displayed his lupine talents in "Fables" #48 and 49, which both debuted in 2006.

Alaska.

	Bigby is living in a log cabin in the middle of the woods, having doubled back to evade pursuers. Mowgli drags Bigby back to Fabletown in "Fables" #50, which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: With whom is Bigby living when Mowgli finds him?
questions.explanation:
Sarah Tanaraq.

	Sarah thinks that Bigby is some kind of secret agent, and recognizes that her time with him is limited. Nonetheless, she sheds tears when Bigby departs with Mowgli. Sarah first appeared in "Fables" #49, which debuted in 2006.

questions.text: As a result of Bigby's return, Bagheera is freed.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Imprisoned on the Farm ever since taking part in a rebellion, Bagheera is freed when Mowgli finds Bigby. Up until then, poor Boy Blue had to sweep and clean his cage! Bagheera gets out of his prison in "Fables" #50, which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: What country does Bigby compare to Fabletown?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	Israel fervently defends itself from larger enemies, says Bigby, and is thus much like Fabletown. Bigby tells this to Geppetto's face after beginning a secret and dangerous mission into the Homelands in "Fables" #49, which went on sale in 2006.

The Magic Grove.

	Bigby destroyed the Magic Grove, the group of trees that are used to carve wooden soldiers, in retaliation for the wooden soldier's march on Fabletown some years ago. Bigby escaped again via a magic beanstalk in "Fables" #50, which went on sale in 2006.

questions.text: Rose Red was the maid of honor at the wedding.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Bigby Wolf married Snow White in the fiftieth issue of "Fables", which hit stands in 2006. Boy Blue was the best man and Rose Red was the maid of honor. The two were married by Old King Cole and all of Fabletown was in attendance.

Rumbold.

	Cinderella undertakes a dangerous mission in the Cloud Kingdom to gain their cooperation and allegiance against the hordes of the Adversary. Sadly, no treaty can be signed because the king is sick with an earache which, thanks to the Kingdom's primitive medicines, can be fatal. Rumbold's ear hurt in "Fables" #51, which debuted in 2006.
